content.prompt: The policy position of the Manitoba Liberal Party quoted in the appeal is best seen as a continuation of which of the following broader trends in the late 1800s and early 1900s?

choices.label: Mainstream political parties teaming up to defeat challenges from socialist parties
Political parties embracing mass politics and broader popular participation in the democratic process
The growing acceptance of free-trade and laissez-faire economic philosophy by both liberals and conservatives
The increasing influence on politics of ethnic nationalism and its ideas of women as essential to the moral character of the nation

topic.text: 9.5: Calls for Reform and Responses after 1900

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Explain how a specific historical development or process is situated within a broader historical context.
